alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SOMERSET AND SOUTHWESTERN DORCHESTER COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Patuxent River Naval Air Station, or over Lexington Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Somerset and southwestern Dorchester Counties, including the following locations... Madison, Taylors Island, Woolford, Andrews, Crocheron, Dames Quarter, Church Creek, Bucktown, and Wingate. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
